message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Using the World Development Indicators dataset from the World Bank, we explore the relationship between life expectancy and GDP per capita.", "dataset": ["World Development Indicators"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity", "Health", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze data from the Global Climate Observing System to examine the impact of climate change on coral reefs in Southeast Asia.", "dataset": ["Global Climate Observing System"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "This study combines data from the National Longitudinal Survey of Youth with the National Health Interview Survey to investigate the relationship between higher education and physical health.", "dataset": ["National Longitudinal Survey of Youth", "National Health Interview Survey"], "topic": ["Education", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "Drawing on data from the Food and Agriculture Organization Corporate Statistical Database and the World Bank Open Data Platform, we explore the role of agricultural productivity in reducing poverty.", "dataset": ["Food and Agriculture Organization Corporate Statistical Database", "World Bank Open Data Platform"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Poverty", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the Global Terrorism Database and the Fragile States Index, this paper examines the relationship between terrorism and state fragility in North Africa.", "dataset": ["Global Terrorism Database", "Fragile States Index"], "topic": ["Fragility, Conflict, and Violence"]}, {"sentence": "We use a combination of household survey data and satellite imagery data to investigate the impact of climate change on rural households in sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["household survey data", "satellite imagery data"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Environment", "Poverty", "Rural Development"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses case study data from public-private partnerships in different sectors, including transportation and energy, to examine factors that contribute to successful implementation.", "dataset": ["case study data"], "topic": ["Public-Private Partnerships", "Transportation", "Energy"]}, {"sentence": "Combining data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys and the Doing Business database, we investigate the impact of business regulation on firm performance in Latin America.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys", "Doing Business database"], "topic": ["Competitiveness", "Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the Global Burden of Disease Study and the World Health Organization Mortality Database, we examine the relationship between air pollution and health outcomes in cities around the world.", "dataset": ["Global Burden of Disease Study", "World Health Organization Mortality Database"], "topic": ["Health", "Urban Development", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "Drawing on household survey data and taxation data from the Chilean government, we investigate the impact of social protection programs on income inequality in Chile.", "dataset": ["household survey data", "taxation data from the Chilean government"], "topic": ["Social Protection", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}]
